intro: Lesquerella gordonii var. sessilis, commonly known as the sessile lesquerella, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with fleshy, sessile leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, typical of the mustard family. It is known for its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments, making it well-adapted to drought conditions. Lesquerella gordonii var. sessilis is also valued for its potential in ecological restoration and as a source of natural oils.
